abstract: Friends Chris Tepper and Paul Kelterborn are spearheading effort to turn former St Vincent's Triangle Park in Greenwich Village into neighborhood park and memorial to those who lost their lives to AIDS and to those who cared for them before they died; tens of thousands of hospital residents were among the 100,000 New Yorkers who died from 1981 to 1996, peak of epidemic.
snippet: Two men have proposed creating a memorial park in Greenwich Village to those who died from AIDS and to the New Yorkers who cared for them before they died.
lead_paragraph: Two men have proposed creating a memorial park in Greenwich Village to those who died from AIDS and to the New Yorkers who cared for them before they died.

headline.main: A Park, a Memorial, a Debate
headline.print_headline: A Park, a Memorial, a Debate
headline.seo: Push Is On for AIDS Memorial in Greenwich Village Park
